title: Summoner Icon Description
body:
I didn't really find a proper Board for this, so I'm going to use the Story & Art board (because it kinda contains/targets art). Please forgive me.

My idea was to add descriptions to summoner icons, so people actually know what they mean. Sometimes I see icons of other people or own icons and I don't know how they or I got them. It would be nice to have a description of sorts, see attached images.

While this feature might just look like a gimmick, I think it would add a nice level of transparency. It also makes icons more worthy to strive for as the option to see what it was rewarded for allows people to show off, as it adds extra value and weight to the individual icons.

The first two images are examples when choosing a summoner icon. The third one is an idea that when you are in the loading screen, you can hover over a players summoner icon to see what it was rewarded for.

EDIT: Also an important point is that icons have evolved to League of Legends own little achievement system to a certain degree. Thanks to kanacho for the comment.

EDIT2: CaptainMårvelous had the idea to add flavored text, this I added a 4th attachment *SummonerIconIdea04.png* as an example

replies.body: It's a good idea, although all of the descriptions on how to get each icon is fairly simple to find.

You are right for most of the icons and also if you have played the game for a few years. But there are lots of new players that have never seen these icons before. Even I didn't know some icons existed and I've been playing this game for roughly 4 years. Just a few days ago I started playing Teambuilder for fun and started seeing icons I have never seen before. Those were Teambuilder specific icons.

At that time it would have been nice if I was able to just hover over the summoner icon in the loading screen and read a description, e.g. "This icon is rewarded for 5 wins with a support in Teambuilder.". And there is also the reasoning that some icons might be ugly but hard to achieve. Adding the description gives certain icons more value as said in my thread post and players might be more motivated to get icons as it is more than just the icon itself you get. It's like a trophy and the guarantee that other players can truely appreciate it. I hope I make sense. ._.

Basically what I'm trying to say is that icons will be more desirable and valuable. It adds a similar feel to them like old legacy skins or generally skins that are not available anymore.

Not sure what your post is supposed to mean because it doesn't make sense.

Sure, you can always find information on a wiki page, but it just makes it harder for the player to find the information when it could easily be in the game client. There is literally no reason to make that information not available to the player immediately.

Imagine your runes wouldn't say what they improve, instead they'd just be called "Rune of Offense" and you had to check on a wiki how much extra damage that rune gives. It'd be tedious. Though not to the same degree this also applies to icons.

> Not sure what your post is supposed to mean because it doesn't make sense.
> Sure, you can always find information on a wiki page, but it just makes it harder for the player to find the information when it could easily be in the game client. There is literally no reason to make that information not available to the player immediately.
> 
> Imagine your runes wouldn't say what they improve, instead they'd just be called "Rune of Offense" and you had to check on a wiki how much extra damage that rune gives. It'd be tedious. Though not to the same degree this also applies to icons.

It does make sense. Your example doesn't. Runes are an important part of gameplay, so their descriptions are pretty much mandatory. The description for an icon that is not present at all during games is not.

As well, you're posting in the boards of the developer site. They're not found in game. If you can do that, you can easily google "summoner icon".

So just to make sure, what you are saying is that you are against improving the client by adding more information to it because you can find it on a wikipedia page anyway? This is an improvement with literally no downside but the cost of implementing it.

Of course I can find the description somewhere on a wiki, or possibly a few more other 3rd party sites, but why not make life for everyone easier and implement that information in the client where it belongs in the first place?

In the end everyone is entitled to their own opinion, I just don't see why some are so eager to fight against improvement.

Anyone curious enough to see what an icon is can find a full description and list of icons by googling "summoner icon".

The LoL wikia is the very first result of that search. It seems to be well updated, and their summoner icon article seems to have all of them as well as descriptions on how to get them.
